Class TUI

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Client.View.TUI.TUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientModelObserver, ViewAdapter
public class TUI extends Object implements ClientModelObserver, ViewAdapter
The TUI class represents the Text User Interface for interacting with the game. It serves as an implementation of both the ClientModelObserver and ViewAdapter interfaces, allowing it to respond to game model updates and provide a text-based interface for the user.

  • Method Details

    • askCommand

      public boolean askCommand(String inputLine)
      Parses a command input string and extracts the command name and its parameters. The method validates the input format and ensures it adheres to the expected structure. The expected format is: `commandName(param1, param2, ...)`. - The command name must precede an opening parenthesis `(`. - Parameters are separated by commas `,` and enclosed within parentheses. - Whitespace is ignored.
      Parameters:
      inputLine - the input string containing the command and its parameters
      Returns:
      false if the input is valid and successfully parsed, true otherwise

    • findCommand

      public Command findCommand()
      Searches for a command in the list of all available commands by its name.
      Returns:
      the Command object if found, or null if no command with the specified name exists

    • showCardPile

      public void showCardPile(int idx, ClientModel model)
      Displays the cards from a specified pile of the card deck. Only the first three cards from the pile are shown.
      Specified by:
      showCardPile in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      idx - the index of the card pile to display
      model - the client model containing the game state and card piles

    • showShipboardGrid

      public void showShipboardGrid(String player, ClientModel clientModel)
      Displays the shipboard grid for a specific player, including detailed ship information and the grid representation that shows the components positioned on the shipboard.
      Specified by:
      showShipboardGrid in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player whose shipboard grid is to be displayed
      clientModel - the client model containing the player's shipboard and associated game state

    • showShipboardStandByComponents

      public void showShipboardStandByComponents(String player, ClientModel clientModel)
      Displays the shipboard standby component area for a specified player. The method retrieves the player's shipboard from the client model and prints a visual representation of the standby components section.
      Specified by:
      showShipboardStandByComponents in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player whose standby components are to be displayed
      clientModel - the client model containing the player's shipboard and game state

    • showFlightboard

      public void showFlightboard(ClientModel clientModel)
      Displays the flightboard by printing the contents of the flightboard positions retrieved from the given client model. The flightboard shows the names of items and their corresponding positions.
      Specified by:
      showFlightboard in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      clientModel - the client model containing the flightboard and game state

    • showCard

      public void showCard(AdventureCard card, ClientModel model)
      Displays the provided adventure card in a suitable format using the given client model. If the card is null, a message indicating the absence of a card is displayed. If the card is a type that can be viewed, it will invoke its specific visualization logic. Unsupported card types will result in an error message.
      Specified by:
      showCard in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      card - the adventure card to be displayed; can be null or an instance of a supported card type
      model - the client model containing the game state and other necessary data for card display

    • showUncoveredComponentTiles

      public void showUncoveredComponentTiles(ClientModel clientModel)
      Prints information about uncovered component tiles in TUI
      Specified by:
      showUncoveredComponentTiles in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      clientModel - the current client model state

    • showLeaderboard

      public void showLeaderboard(ClientModel clientModel)
      Displays the leaderboard for the game by calculating and ranking players' scores based on their shipboard scores and additional bonuses. The leaderboard is printed in descending order of scores.
      Specified by:
      showLeaderboard in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      clientModel - the client model containing the game state, including shipboards and flightboard data, used to calculate and display the leaderboard

    • showAvailableCommands

      public void showAvailableCommands(ClientModel clientModel)
      Displays a list of all available commands to the user by printing their names. The commands are determined based on the current client model's state.
      Specified by:
      showAvailableCommands in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      clientModel - the client model containing the state of the game, which is used to determine the list of available commands

    • showTileInHand

      public void showTileInHand(String player, ClientModel clientModel)
      Displays the tile currently in hand for a specified player. If no tile is in hand, a message indicating the absence of a tile is shown. Otherwise, the tile is visually represented using ASCII characters.
      Specified by:
      showTileInHand in interface ViewAdapter
      Parameters:
      player - the name of the player whose tile in hand is to be displayed
      clientModel - the client model containing the player's shipboard and game state
